<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=8528>

Martin Maechler (<mailto:maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch|maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch>) changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
         Resolution|---                         |FIXED
             Status|ASSIGNED                    |CLOSED

--- Comment #9 from Martin Maechler (<mailto:maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch|maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch>) ---
Indeed, there has not been any publication nor tech report / vignette yet,
about how accurate our incomplete Gamma function `pgamma()` in R, currently is.
The duplicated Bug 14710 (`qchisq()`)  and the related bug 15628 (a `dpois()`
inaccuracy for large arguments) have been fixed.

OTOH, empirical evidence has shown the high accuracy in many parts of the
*current* implementation  which has many *many* times improved from then this
Bug 8528 was opened.  Notably I claim that the title (given in 2006) really
does no longer apply.

As I have also assigned Bug 15628 to myself and kept open (even though the
concrete example cases all have been fixed), remaining open issues should be
followed up there, and I am now closing this one.

<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18173>

Martin Maechler (<mailto:maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch|maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch>) changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
         Resolution|---                         |INVALID
                 CC|                            |maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch
             Status|UNCONFIRMED                 |CLOSED

--- Comment #2 from Martin Maechler (<mailto:maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch|maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch>) ---
I don't see a real bug here, nor interest from R core to change the
documentation written consciously and with some intent:  Users should use
`lm()` and the large functionality provided to analyze results of `lm()` and
infer hopefully valid conclusions via plots, diagnostics and further model
checking all provided by the base `{stats}` package and quite a few extensional
CRAN (et al) packages.

We are grateful for suggestions adding words / some sentences somewhere, fixing
typos or otherwise *improving* current docs, but are not enthused about
removing things written with some purpose.
